clinical_study.official_title: Efficacy and Safety of Fecal Microbiota Transplantation for Epilepsy

lead_sponsor.agency: The Second Hospital of Nanjing Medical University

clinical_study.source: The Second Hospital of Nanjing Medical University

brief_summary.textblock: Increasing evidences showed the microbiota effects on neuropsychiatric disorders. This clinical trial aims to evaluate the efficacy and safety of fecal microbiota transplantation for epilepsy.

detailed_description.textblock: Very few literatures reported the clinical use of microbiota or bacteria for brain diseases. The most effective strategy for reconstruction of gut microbiota should be fecal microbiota transplantation (FMT). This study aims to evaluate the efficacy and safety of FMT for epilepsy. Patients were diagnosed as epilepsy by electroencephalogram (EEG) and MRI and clinical data when the study began and then were randomly assigned to groups that received single FMT with fecal from healthy donors or placebo with equal water. Patients (blinded) were required to stop antiepileptic drugs after FMT and the follow up last for 6 months.The primary outcome measure was the frequency of the seizures. Secondary outcome measure were the examination of EEG and MRI.

primary_outcome.description: The frequency of seizures of patients during the follow-up(6 months) and compare that before FMT.

secondary_outcome.description: Participants were examined by electroencephalogram (EEG) and compared with that before FMT.
Participants were examined by magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) and compared with that before FMT.
Number of participants with treatment-related adverse events as assessed by CTCAE v4.0 after FMT.

arm_group.description: Participants undergo single FMT with 200ml microbiota suspension.
Participants undergo single FMT with 200ml normal saline.

intervention.description: The prepared microbiota suspension was infused into mid-gut.
The saline (placebo) was infused into mid-gut.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- epilepsy diagnosed by typical electroencephalogram (EEG) and Magnetic resonance imaging (MRI)
- frequent relapses of epilepsy (> one seizure per 6 months) at a stabilize extent every year
Exclusion Criteria:
- complicated with certain brain disease, including tumor,injury,cerebrovascular disease
- complicated with other severe disease, including cancers, organ failure, heart diseases
- Follow-up less than 6 months
